gr.forth.ics.jbenchy
Class Database

java.lang.Object
  gr.forth.ics.jbenchy.Database

public abstract class Database
extends java.lang.Object

A database can create and contain Aggregators.

Author:
andreou
See Also:
Aggregator

Constructor Detail

Database

public Database()
Method Detail

forceCreate

public Aggregator forceCreate(Schema schema,
                              java.lang.String name)
                       throws SQLRuntimeException
Creates an aggregator that is backed up with a strictly new table (with the specified name) in this database and adheres to given specified schema. In other words, if a table with the same name exists, it is dropped and recreated.

Parameters:
schema - the schema that the created aggregator will adhere to
name - the name of the aggregator, and also the name of the table that will back the returned aggregator up
Returns:
a new Aggregator instance
Throws:
SQLRuntimeException - when the underlying database throws an exception

getOrCreate

public Aggregator getOrCreate(Schema schema,
                              java.lang.String name)
                       throws SQLRuntimeException
Returns an aggregator with the specified schema and name, backed up with an existing table with the same name, or a new one if no such table exists.

Note that if an existing table is found, the returned aggregator may have less specific data types in comparison to the ones used to originally created it (this affects types which are parameterized by custom lengths).

Parameters:
schema - the schema that the created aggregator will adhere to
name - the name of the aggregator, and also the name of the table that will back the returned aggregator up
Returns:
a new Aggregator instance
Throws:
SQLRuntimeException - when the underlying database throws an exception

delete

public abstract boolean delete(java.lang.String name)
Drops a table with the specified name.

Parameters:
name - the name of the table to drop
Returns:
true if a table was actually dropped

get

public abstract Aggregator get(java.lang.String name)
                        throws SQLRuntimeException
Returns an aggregator with the specified name, which is backed up with an existing table of the same name. This operation is guaranteed to never drop or create tables; an SQLException will be thrown if the specified table is not found.

Parameters:
name - the name of the aggregator to return, as well as the name of the backing table
Returns:
an Aggregator instance with the specified name
Throws:
SQLRuntimeException - if the specified table is not found, or the database throws an exception

create

public abstract Aggregator create(Schema schema,
                                  java.lang.String name)
                           throws SQLRuntimeException
Returns an aggregator backed up by a created table with the given schema and name. If such a table already exists, then an SQLException will be thrown.

Parameters:
schema - the schema that the returned aggregator will adhere to
name - the name of the returned aggregator, as well as the name of the backing table
Returns:
an Aggregator instance with the specified name
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when the underlying database throws an exception
SQLRuntimeException

shutDown

public abstract void shutDown()
Attempts to cleanly shutdown the database.
